intro: Sida scabrida, commonly known as rough sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, serrated leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in spikes, and it produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. Sida scabrida is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
